column1:

Link with 'http[s]://' will be added as it is.
column2:

column1: The hreflang tag helps the Web crawler understand which version of the website should be shown for a certain location. The hreflang settings can be managed depending on the store view. To change the store view use the dropdown on the upper left side of the configuration page.
column2: The hreflang tag helps the Web crawler understand which version of the website should be shown for a certain location. The hreflang settings can be managed depending on the store view. To change the store view use the dropdown on the upper left side of the configuration page.

column1: Specify the Alternate URLs Scope. If set to Website, the Hreflang URLs work within one website only. If set to Global, the Hreflang URLs work between websites.
column2: Specify the Alternate URLs Scope. If set to Website, the Hreflang URLs work within one website only. If set to Global, the Hreflang URLs work between websites.

column1: Specifies how to identify the same CMS page for different store views. Use By ID if you create one page for different stores, therefore, their ID will be the same. Use By URL Key if you created separate pages for different stores and assign them the same URL. Use By Hreflang Key for the pages that are linked manually.
column2: Specifies how to identify the same CMS page for different store views. Use By ID if you create one page for different stores, therefore, their ID will be the same. Use By URL Key if you created separate pages for different stores and assign them the same URL. Use By Hreflang Key for the pages that are linked manually.

column1: To observe the changes, click the Save Config button.
column2: To observe the changes, click the Save Config button.

column1: You need to disable the standard Magento canonical first.
column2: You need to disable the standard Magento canonical first.

column1: The default setting to add the canonical tag.
column2: The default setting to add the canonical tag.

column1: Disable Canonical URL for Pages with NOINDEX robots
column2: Disable Canonical URL for Pages with NOINDEX robots

column1: Disables the canonical URL if the page has the NOINDEX meta robots tag. Useful as the NOINDEX pages won't be shown in the search results.
column2: Disables the canonical URL if the page has the NOINDEX meta robots tag. Useful as the NOINDEX pages won't be shown in the search results.

column1: Canonical URL won't be added for these pages
column2: Canonical URL won't be added for these pages

column1:
Hides the canonical URL on the pages added in this setting.
Action names allowed: use catalog_category_view for all categories, catalog_product_view for all products.
column2:
Hides the canonical URL on the pages added in this setting.
Action names allowed: use catalog_category_view for all categories, catalog_product_view for all products.

column1: Define the main storeview for the canonical URL. Useful for websites with several storeviews having the same or quite similar content. Use Custom URL to add any other website.
column2: Define the main storeview for the canonical URL. Useful for websites with several storeviews having the same or quite similar content. Use Custom URL to add any other website.

column1: The options depend on the "Use Categories Path for Product URLs" setting.
column2: The options depend on the "Use Categories Path for Product URLs" setting.

column1: The associated products of the chosen product types will have the canonical tag pointed to the parent (main) product.
column2: The associated products of the chosen product types will have the canonical tag pointed to the parent (main) product.

column1: Trailing Slash For Home Page Canonical URL
column2: Trailing Slash For Home Page Canonical URL

column1: The homepage can be indexed as both https://www.site.com and https://www.site.com/. The canonical can either have this trailing slash (add) or not (crop). The trailing slash can be added to the pages without suffix .html or .htm
column2: The homepage can be indexed as both https://www.site.com and https://www.site.com/. The canonical can either have this trailing slash (add) or not (crop). The trailing slash can be added to the pages without suffix .html or .htm

column1: The web pages can be indexed as both https://www.site.com/page and https://www.site.com/page/. The canonical can either have this trailing slash (add) or not (crop). The trailing slash can be added to the pages without suffix .html or .htm
column2: The web pages can be indexed as both https://www.site.com/page and https://www.site.com/page/. The canonical can either have this trailing slash (add) or not (crop). The trailing slash can be added to the pages without suffix .html or .htm

column1: Use Pager For Category Canonical URL
column2: Use Pager For Category Canonical URL

column1: Add or remove the pager (?p=2 etc.) parameter from the canonical tag on the category pages.
column2: Add or remove the pager (?p=2 etc.) parameter from the canonical tag on the category pages.

column1: Canonical Tag for Category Layered Navigation
column2: Canonical Tag for Category Layered Navigation

column1: To see the differences among the options, click here. To overwrite this setting for each product attribute individually, go to Attributes Grid>Attribute>Storefront Properties and change the 'Canonical Tag for Pages Filtered by Layered Navigation Leads to' setting.
column2: To see the differences among the options, click here. To overwrite this setting for each product attribute individually, go to Attributes Grid>Attribute>Storefront Properties and change the 'Canonical Tag for Pages Filtered by Layered Navigation Leads to' setting.

column2: Manages the canonical for any link that has the one-time selection of the several filters options within the same filter (multi-select). This setting works with MageWorx LayeredNavigation extension
